generif.text: Cloning and expression of the gene; specifically expressed in brain and heart
smap8 is involved in the regulation of mitogenic signalling in vascular smooth muscle cells, possibly in response to a homocysteine-induced injury [SMAP8]
NDRG4 overexpression enhances ERK activation
Meta-analysis and genome-wide association study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
NDRG4 is a candidate tumor suppressor gene in colorectal cancer whose expression is frequently inactivated by promoter methylation.
NDRG4 is required for cell cycle progression and survival, thereby diverging in function from its tumor suppressive family member NDRG2 in astrocytes and GBM cells
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
expression of NDRG4 is downregulated in human gliomas. The glioma patients with lower NDRG4 expression have a poor prognosis.
Over expression of NDRG4 inhibited proliferation of GBM cells.
NDRG4 is involved in modulating cell proliferation, invasion, migration and angiogenesis in meningioma, and may play a valuable role as a molecular target in its treatment
summarizes the current research on NDRG3 and NDRG4,including the molecular structure, cellular and tissue distribution, biological function, and function in cancer.
Methylation level in stool decreases dramatically following colorectal cancer resection
A homozygous variant in NDRG4 may be the causative variant of the autosomal recessive form of infantile myofibromatosis.
Two downregulated genes, NDRG4 and GINS3, have been located in a genomic interval associated with cardiac repolarization in published GWASs and zebra fish knockout models
These findings bring novel insight to the roles of NDRG4 in meningioma progression
Data indicate that patients with tumor of reduced NDRG family member 4 protein (NDRG4) mRNA level had unfavorable disease-free and overall survival.

Study shows that NDRG4 was significantly up-regulated in glioblastomas (GBM) and seems to play a role in GBM prognosis. These results indicate that NDRG4 gene in MGMT-methylated cells is a putative tumor-suppressor gene and an oncogene in cells with unmethylated MGMT.
NDRG4 might play an important role during early pregnancy.
NDRG4 promoter hypermethylation contributed to the risk of gastric cancer and predicted a poor prognosis in Chinese gastric cancer patients.
NDRG4 - the biomarker of a currently in-use multi-target stool DNA test was commonly expressed in tumor tissue specimens, independent of Fecal Immunochemical Test result.
NDRG4 is exclusively expressed by central, peripheral and enteric neurons/nerves, suggesting a neuronal-specific role of this protein
Results indicate that NDRG family member 4 protein (NDRG4) could be a potential tumor suppressor and prognostic marker of gastric cancer.
NDRG4 Alleviates Abeta1-40 Induction of SH-SY5Y Cell Injury via Activation of BDNF-Inducing Signalling Pathways.
MiR-433 Regulates Myocardial Ischemia Reperfusion Injury by Targeting NDRG4 Via the PI3K/Akt Pathway.
TFPI2 and NDRG4 gene promoter methylation analysis in peripheral blood mononuclear cells are novel epigenetic noninvasive biomarkers for colorectal cancer diagnosis.
A loss-of-function mutation p.T256M in NDRG4 is implicated in the pathogenesis of pulmonary atresia with ventricular septal defect (PA/VSD) and tetralogy of Fallot (TOF).
Hypermethylation-mediated silencing of NDRG4 promotes pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma by regulating mitochondrial function.
Identification of NDRG Family Member 4 (NDRG4) and CDC28 Protein Kinase Regulatory Subunit 2 (CKS2) as Key Prognostic Genes in Adrenocortical Carcinoma by Transcriptomic Analysis.
Loss of enteric neuronal Ndrg4 promotes colorectal cancer via increased release of Nid1 and Fbln2.
Highly sensitive fecal DNA testing of NDRG4 12b methylation is a promising marker for detection of colorectal precancerosis.
Errate: Identification of NDRG Family Member 4 (NDRG4) and CDC28 Protein Kinase Regulatory Subunit 2 (CKS2) as Key Prognostic Genes in Adrenocortical Carcinoma by Transcriptomic Analysis.
miR-23a-3p promotes the development of colon cancer by inhibiting the expression of NDRG4.

name: NDRG family member 4
summary: This gene is a member of the N-myc downregulated gene family which belongs to the alpha/beta hydrolase superfamily. The protein encoded by this gene is a cytoplasmic protein that is required for cell cycle progression and survival in primary astrocytes and may be involved in the regulation of mitogenic signalling in vascular smooth muscles cells. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcripts encoding different isoforms.[provided by RefSeq, Jun 2011].
